pages.text: Any novice practitioner will face the need for suitable containers. Heat-resistant glass vials are versatile vessels for storing liquids, powders, and volatile essences.

pages.title: Petrichor
pages.text: Petrichor, the scent of dust after rain, is favored by wizards and herbalists. Dark oak adds somber notes of dampness, ideal for this essence.

pages.title: Smell of Home
pages.text: Oak symbolizes home, comfort, and warm memories. This aroma, often called 'nostalgia,' is used to replenish strength.

pages.title: Desert Spirit
pages.text: Cactus provides the essence of the desert, representing life among the endless sandy steppes where the Sun mercilessly scorches.

pages.title: Sweet Dream
pages.text: Sugar cane induces drowsiness and sweet dreams, symbolizing sunset, fatigue, and relaxation.

pages.title: Soaring Lightness
pages.text: Azalea, a remarkable plant, provides an essence of upliftment, lightness, and elevation, loved by potion brewers.

pages.title: Soaring Lightness
pages.text: Flowering azalea contains a higher concentration of lightness essence, used in enhancing and accelerating living organisms.

pages.title: Ring of Morning Dew
pages.text: The ring of morning dew, delightful to the eye and ear, is best extracted from birch, symbolizing beauty and joyful awakening.

pages.title: Wasteland Wind
pages.text: The dusty, dry wind of the savannas is tied to acacias. Herbalists extract the essence of wasteland wind from their saplings.

pages.title: Coniferous Oil
pages.text: Spruce is a source of magical energy, allowing experienced herbalists to extract coniferous oil for potions and enchantments.

pages.title: Stink of Swamp
pages.text: Swamps are centers of natural magical energy. The foul vapors from mangrove shoots are used to capture the spirit of the swamp.

pages.title: Absolute Order
pages.text: Rowan is a pure source of primal natural magic, symbolizing order amidst chaos. Its energy is used to dispel chaos and direct magic.

pages.title: Tropical Monsoon
pages.text: The essence of tropical forests, rich in magical energy, symbolizes the power of rain and untamed nature, valued by herbalists.

pages.title: Cherry Etude
pages.text: Cherry, embodying harmony and melody, is an excellent source of essence used by Eastern herbalists for creating high-resonance artifacts.

pages.title: Whiff of Time
pages.text: The Kramer Tree, soaked with generations' blood, symbolizes the passage of time, reminding of the relentless march leading to creation.

pages.title: Tune of Harmony
pages.text: Sage, filled with the energy of order and harmony, sharpens senses and brings clarity, cherished by herbalists.

pages.title: Tune of Harmony
pages.text: Ground sage is more pliable, increasing the chance of obtaining the desired essence when burned.

pages.title: Scent of Uncertainty
pages.text: The Nameless Tree exudes uncertainty and questions. Its unique scent is popular among wizards who dare to play with fate.
